qas.question: How many ports does Oklahoma have?
Which port in Oklahoma handles international cargo?
Where is the furthest-inland oceangoing port in the US?
How many tons of cargo does the Tulsa Port of Catoosa ship annually?
What connects the two Oklahoma ports?

answers.text: the McClellan-Kerr Arkansas River Navigation System

context: <a0_0>Two<a0_0/> inland ports on rivers serve Oklahoma: the Port of Muskogee and the Tulsa Port of Catoosa. The only port handling international cargo in the state, the <a1_0><a2_0>Tulsa<a2_0/> Port of Catoosa<a1_0/> is the most inland ocean-going port in the nation and ships <a3_0>over two million<a3_0/> tons of cargo each year. Both ports are located on <a4_0>the McClellan-Kerr Arkansas River Navigation System<a4_0/>, which connects barge traffic from Tulsa and Muskogee to the Mississippi River via the Verdigris and Arkansas rivers, contributing to one of the busiest waterways in the world.
